title: Autonomous Learning Design for Mathematics Modeling Based on Final-Year Medical Education Portfolios

context.prior_knowledge: Completed masterâ€™s in medicine, clinical practice experience, and foundational statistics (mean, standard deviation) and probability theory (conditional probability, Bayesian inference) understanding
context.additional_context: Operates a comprehensive evaluation system through lifelong learning competency enhancement and portfolio assessment for medical professionals. Emphasizes competency evaluation using mathematical approaches, including medical data analysis (data cleansing, variable extraction), probabilistic modeling (Monte Carlo simulation), and result visualization (graphs, charts).

learning_goals: Learners can establish and execute self-directed study plans using mathematical modeling and statistical techniques (regression analysis, probability distributions) for medical data analysis.

Learners can systematize clinical experiences and research outcomes in portfolios using quantitative metrics (mean, standard deviation) and graphs (histograms, scatter plots), and reflect through mathematical analysis (trend analysis, correlation verification).
Professional attitudes and practical competencies aligned with CanMEDs competency standards are measured using mathematical evaluation tools (rating scales, statistical significance tests).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
